title: Ready Trader One: Events, Stocks To Watch At E3
text: The 24th Electronic Entertainment Expo (E3) kicks off June 11 in Los Angeles, but the news is already flowing this weekend, with many gaming companies showcasing their biggest announcements and presentations.

title: IMF's Lagarde highlights potential disruptive nature of fintech
text: International Monetary Fund Managing Director Christine Lagarde warned on Saturday that the increasing presence of technology giants using big data and artificial intelligence could cause a significant disruption to the world's financial system.

title: Trump says he is confident Mexico will enforce new immigration deal
text: U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday predicted Mexico would strongly enforce a new deal under which it agreed to expand a controversial asylum program and boost security on its southern border to stem Central American migrants trying to reach the United States.

title: China reportedly summoned tech giants — and warned against cooperating with Trump's sales ban
text: Chinese government officials summoned major technology companies this week to warn them that they will face consequences for complying with the Trump administration’s policies, according to The New York Times.

title: Mnuchin plans private talks with China central bank chief amid stalled trade negotiations
text: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin is urging China to return to trade negotiations after progress with Mexico. Mnuchin said he plans to meet privately with the head of China's central bank at the G-20 finance ministers meeting in Japan.

title: Mnuchin says Trump can still impose tariffs if Mexico does not live up to immigration deal
text: Mnuchin said the immigration deal had met Trump's objectives, but he can still impose tariffs if Mexico does not live up to agreement.

title: Inverted Yield Curve: A US Recession Signal?
text: Interest rates allow investors to observe the state of the economy and, at the same time, are an instrument of monetary policy control.

title: This chart suggests Treasury yields are months away from bottoming because of a ‘persistent’ inflation downturn
text: Economic forecaster Lakshman Achuthan sees a bearish trend unfolding that should keep Treasury yields at multi-year lows longer than Wall Street anticipates.

title: China to curb some technology exports to U.S.: Global Times editor
text: China is preparing to curb some technology exports to the United States, the chief editor of China's Global Times newspaper said on Saturday.

title: NYC to Shanghai in 40 minutes: SpaceX's goal for point-to-point space travel
text: UBS believes that, if the obstacles to point-to-point space travel can be overcome, the service would represent an annual market of more than $20 billion.

title: Startups Weekly: The Peloton IPO (bull vs. bear)
text: In this week's newsletter: Bird gets acquisitive, Stripe puts on its VC hat and Thumbtack looks for new cash.

title: Marijuana industry could surpass NFL in revenue by 2020
text: Cannabis has been extending its reach through legalization over the past several years. Starting with early adopter Colorado, 37 states have passed legislation allowing adult consumption for medical and, in some cases, recreational purposes.

title: Bad Economic News Is Good Again
text: U.S. job creation fell abysmally low … boosting stocks. The S&P 500 capped off a thrilling week as gold hit a new 52-week intra-day high.

title: You Need to Be in This Megatrend
text: Get Ready Now for China’s Next Big Profit Boom

title: Trump deal with Mexico a win for 'hostage-taking': former WTO chief
text: The migration deal imposed on Mexico this week by U.S. President Donald Trump under the threat of punitive tariffs was a victory for "hostage-taking" over international rules, a former head of the World Trade Organization (WTO) said on Saturday.

title: A Look Into Foreign Direct Investment Trends
text: Foreign direct investments play an important role as an indicator of a healthy economy in terms of economic growth and long-term capital movement.

title: The Week Ahead In Biotech: Conferences, PDUFA Dates And Clinical Trial Readouts
text: Biotech stocks staged a steady recovery last week. ASCO presentations dominated the headlines, with Iovance Biotherapeutics Inc and Mirati Therapeutics Inc among the biggest gainers.

title: SEC Approves Reg BI Requiring Financial Advisors To Act In Best Interests Of Clients
text: On June 5, 2019, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) held a meeting that had four specific items to decide. In the meeting, the SEC approved a debated proposal called Regulation Best Interest (Reg BI), holding financial advisors to the best interest standard.

title: The FDA Hearing on CBD Is Really Much Ado About Nothing
text: No matter what the FDA decides with regard to cannabidiol as a food or beverage additive, it'll have little bearing on consumers or investors.

title: The 10 jobs experiencing the fastest pay growth right now
text: Glassdoor chief economist Andrew Chamberlain says the thriving job market "puts many lower-skilled workers in a stronger bargaining position."

title: Iran has no plans to leave OPEC despite tensions: oil minister
text: Iran has no plans to leave the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries despite being treated like an enemy by some fellow members, Oil Minister Bijan Zanganeh said in an interview published on Saturday.

title: An IPO could make these workers wealthy – or leave them holding nothing
text: Not all start-ups grow up to be Facebook. For the lucky few that do, their employees might have access to a small fortune: stock options.

title: Take Five: Enter the dragon

title: A Week’s Worth of Analysts and Economists in 5 Minutes
text: The first week of June 2019 was one of those that felt like a head-scratcher. After all the “sell in May and go away” worries, what started out as an oversold rally on Tuesday became more exaggerated as equity investors ironically have started cheering for weaker economic readings.

title: A 5% Income Strategy For Bull Markets And Bear Markets
text: The stock market has been very jittery and volatile since last month, and the future direction remains unclear. However, it has recovered some of the losses since then.

title: U.S. Treasury's Mnuchin says Trump-Xi meeting has parallels to Buenos Aires summit
text: A highly anticipated late June meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping has some parallels with their Buenos Aires summit last December that postponed a tariff hike, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Saturday.

title: Stocks To Watch: Chewy IPO, Lululemon And Tesla On Tap

title: Large-Cap Real Estate Was The Top U.S. Segment In May
text: Large-cap Real Estate was the only segment of the U.S. equity market to post a gain in May.
